text: I had a dream a few nights ago. I was walking around campus with this one guy I like, just chilling, holding hands (I could feel that). going to a concert and then being left behind it wasnt detailed and blurry

I have a vivid dream every couple of weeks about tornadoes, specifically about hiding from them. The most recent took place in a school where every wall had a window so there was no where to really hide. Me and a group of other girls had to find our way to the gym, the only place in the school with no windows. The problem was that we had to go through a big door, then a tiny hole in the wall to get in. We barely made it because we kept having to stop and drop for cover because there were at least three tornadoes. In the dream I was very anxious that I wouldn't make it into the gym in time. I was also stressed because no one was taking the tornado seriously, and I was the only one hiding, everyone else was just going on as if it were a pointless drill. The interesting part about these dreams is that I'm from Colorado, where we never have tornadoes.

I ran out side of the building and remember the feeling of like wind on my face but always feeling like someone was behind me. First person POV, on a date with the person I like. I felt really happy. I could hear just normal background noises as if it was real life.

I had a dream recently that stuck with me. It started with me sitting in a classroom, waiting for my grade on a big exam. When the paper came back, 'F' was written across the top in red. My chest sank, and it felt like everyone else in the room knew I had failed too, even though no one said anything.
The scene shifted, and suddenly I was walking outside, but the world felt heavier than usual. It was cloudy and damp, like it had just rained. My shoes splashed in puddles as I walked, but I didn‚Äôt have anywhere to go. In the dream, failing that class meant I had dropped out completely, and I knew I hadn‚Äôt passed my OAT either to get into Optometry school.

Eventually I ended up sitting on a curb in the city. Cars and people moved around me, but it was like I wasn‚Äôt really there, no one noticed me. I felt empty, like I had lost everything I had worked for. The whole dream stayed in first person, so it really felt like I was living through it.

The strongest part wasn‚Äôt the images but the feelings: shame, fear, and a sense of being stuck with no way forward. When I woke up, I still carried that heavy, unsettled feeling for a while.

My dream was in first person view. My two friends and I were at a house but there was a smaller house across the woods where we had to keep our clothes. I remember we walked through the woods and went to the smaller house so we could get our clothes, but when we got there we realized something was wrong with the house. We felt unsettled and I woke up before I could find out what was wrong.

I had a dream where I was with my friends playing pickleball. I remember it in first person, as if I was really standing on the court holding the paddle in my hand. The court was outside, and the ground was a faded green with white lines that almost glowed under the bright afternoon sun. I could feel the paddle‚Äôs rough grip against my palm and hear the sharp pop each time the plastic ball hit it.

My friends were laughing and cheering, and their voices echoed in the open air. The smell of freshly cut grass carried on a light breeze, mixing with the faint rubbery scent of the pickleball itself. I could see my best friend across the net, smiling as they served the ball with a quick flick of their wrist. The yellow ball spun in the air, and I felt a rush of energy as I stepped forward to return it.

The dream felt light and fun‚Äîalmost like time slowed down so we could enjoy it longer. Even though it was competitive, there was no stress, only excitement. I felt connected to my friends, as if we were all on the same team even though we were playing against each other. The emotions were a mix of joy, focus, and pure enjoyment.

When I woke up, I realized that the dream showed me how much I value spending time with my friends and how sports bring us closer together.
I forgot to turn in an assignment and nothing was letting me submit so I felt really stressed out and anxious.

The point of view is first person. I was from a different planet that was purple and orange. This planet was dying, being attacked by giant grub worms, and going into a black hole. I had a twin brother (13 years old), who had brown hair. We had a dog. Both me and my twin brother had the ability to fly, turn invisible, and fire powers. Our parents wanted to save us from our dying planet so they sent us to live with our grandparents on Earth. We were very sad about leaving our parents, but knew it was the best for our safety. We were sent via spaceship and landed on a playground on Earth that our grandparents live close to. None of the kids on the playground reacted when our spaceship landed on their play set. Our grandparents arrived at the park to pick us up and warned us that the Grinch lives on Earth and that his only mission is to find us and kill us. So our job is to blend in with all the other kids and pretend to be normal. However, at school one day, a group of kids see me and my brother turn invisible. So we have to tell them our backstory and they agree to help protect us from the Grinch. On the last day of school, it is dark and stormy. Me and my brother are the only two kids in this specific classroom. We hear a creepy laugh coming from outside of the classroom door and it opens. The Grinch, with a Christmas hat, stands in the door way and says, "I'm gonna get you!" The end. I was very scared at the end of this dream. I woke up at the very end out of fear. However, it was a very enjoyable and long dream to be a part of.

The shadow figure had no distinct facial features or anything, just a 9 foot tall shadow standing there and staring at me. The three friends, Kennedy, Vicki, and Hannah, helped me pick out an outfit for the party, and it was a navy midi dress with ruffles. We went into the bedroom, and my friends left to decorate the apartment. In the bedroom, he got ready for the party, and we had some alone time before a lot of people came. When we were both ready, we walked out of his bedroom, and the apartment was beautifully decorated, and there was fancy sushi on the table for everyone to snack on. I recently had a vivid and unsettling dream. At first, everything felt normal and cheerful. I am working on a biology assignment that required me to find a remote location in the forest. The place was described in a photo, a cave entrance marked by two bear statues. All I had to do was take a picture there as proof.

When I arrived, the atmosphere suddenly became gloomy and heavy. I found the cave and took a quick photo, but then I noticed a group of suspicious people inside. Instead of leaving, I felt a strange pull to step closer and see what was happening. To my horror, I realized they were part of a human trafficking group. My heart pounded, and fear rushed through me. I tried to quietly back away, but they saw me.

I ran as fast as I could, jumped into a passing vehicle, and called the police. I remember feeling a mix of panic and determination. The dream ended vaguely, but I think the authorities caught them. When I woke up, I still felt uneasy, it was both realistic and terrifying.

I knew I had to just make it through my one class I had and then when I got home I could break down and cry. Next thing I know I‚Äôm in my classroom and still thinking about how my dad had passed but then the class is over and everyone had left except for one girl who seemed hesitant to come up to me. I was still sitting down and then I was confused on why this girl who looked Hispanic with pin straight long black hair was walking up to me. Like I had realized God worked through someone else to get to me or show he‚Äôs there for me in hard times. I feel like the reason why I started crying was because I felt reassurance from God that everything was going to be alright. Most of the dream happened in first person but whenever I teared up in the beginning of the dream it was a quick third person view so I could see myself but then I went back to first person. I was in my room. The environment was quite tense and slightly uneasy because of a girl I was with. I thought we were just friends, but looking back, it's difficult to define our relationship. Regardless of our relationship title, we both loved and cared for each other. Her and I felt comfortable around each other. But we were arguing. I felt myself growing emotionally angry as I was passionate about whatever matter we were talking about.
